example_sentences.eng_trans: You may have free activities in the afternoon./You can do whatever you like in the afternoon.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 午後は個人[自由]行動をとってよろしい

example_sentences.eng_trans: a man [a woman] of action;an active person;an aggressive person.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 行動力のある[行動的な]人

example_sentences.eng_trans: He has a wide range [sphere] of action [activities].
His act [action, behavior] was brave./He acted [behaved] bravely.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼の行動は勇敢だった
考えを行動に移す（＝実行する）

example_sentences.eng_trans: act [take action] immediately; take immediate action.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 直ちに行動をとる[起こす]
彼の行動（＝動静）を見守る

example_sentences.eng_trans: You should answer for your actions [what you do].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 自分の行動に責任を持ちなさい

example_sentences.eng_trans: His response was merely verbal and he took no action.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼の返事は口先だけで行動に移さなかった

example_sentences.eng_trans: We spent the whole day together.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私たちは一日中ずっと行動をともにした（＝ともに過ごした）
彼の命令[忠告]に従って行動する
集団で行動する（＝動き回る）

example_sentences.eng_trans: Now is the time for action [to act]./We must act now.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 今こそ行動すべき時だ

example_sentences.eng_trans: You're an adult and should act [behave] accordingly.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 君は大人なんだからそれ相応に行動すべきだ
